reviewDescription: I, literally, just recieved this printer 2 days ago so I cannot, honestly, give a complete review. But, I will say this. This printer, which i use wirelessly in my house, worked right outta the box with the help of the HP Smart app. Couldn't be happier.

Finally had to replace the old printer, also HP, and here we are. I am still working on learning everything about it so I can teach my 85 yr old parents….  So far I really like it. My next step for me is to learn how to connect my cell phone to print off of it. HP always comes through and so always loyal to HP.
If I could set this up all on my own anyone can!  Nuff said, it's a printer.  A big plus, very lightweight!!  Perfect for small jobs, which is all I need.

reviewTitle: Great value and lots of functions
reviewDescription: I’ve been pleasantly surprised with this printer so far. After my old reliable multifunction printer stopped working, I needed a new one and this seemed like an inexpensive option, even though it’s a factory-renewed unit.I was worried after reading some of the reviews on Amazon, but the setup wasn’t terribly difficult. The only problem I had there was with some of the questions that asked me to share more information than I was expecting with HP and deciding whether it made sense to sign up for their ink replenishment service (so far, I haven’t run out of ink). The print quality seems pretty decent, considering the price. The scanner and copier functions also seem to work well enough with a Windows laptop, though I was disappointed that the software didn’t seem to work with my Chromebook. It seems you need a Windows computer (or maybe a Mac). But the HP Smart app seems to work well on my Windows computers as well as an iPhone and an Android phone.It’s nice to have the wireless functionality, which my old printer didn’t have. The one difficulty I had during use was when my computer switched over to a different Wi-Fi network and couldn’t connect to the printer. But I figured out eventually what the problem was. It would be nice if the printer had Bluetooth connections available. There is a USB port that can be used with a USB cable and that may address some of the Wi-Fi issues some reviewers have commented on.All in all, it’s got plenty of features. I haven’t signed  up for the mobile fax service since I have nowhere to send a fax, but it’s nice to know that’s available for 2 years.
Works well.  Had a bit of trouble figuring out how to connect to my home internet/wifi but did get it connected.  I thought the instructions for doing that were confusing
ink read is drying HP 4152e

The printer is a good home printer. However, I was disappointed thatI saw marked on the box after receipt that this printer “was reconditioned by a professional team”. I thought I was buying a “new” device not a used one regardless of the reconditioning. I feel like i was duped

(direct connect cable was included) Certainly do not need HP to monitor how much I print. If I run low on ink, I'll just get more. Printed great right off the bat. Only been hooked up for a few days. Have not scanned yet, but do not forsee any issue.  Note: lid is a little heavier than my last printer. So be careful closing lid when copying or scanning.(Did not give any 5 stars, due to only having used it a few days so far)

reviewDescription: Works well but the Amazon said "NEW" not reconditioned.  Would be nice to know.  HP warrantry does not apply

Received printer, good condition.  Did not set up for a couple of weeks.  When I did , the printing did not function properly.  a Color print came thru with just a few dots of color on the sheet.  A B/W copy came thru blank.  Tried several different sheets.  Took out each ink cartridge, and cleaned them and re-installed.  The color one functioned okay after this.  the black cartridge still did not perform.  Re-cleaned it and did the water soak suggestion as well.  Still no performance.  Ordered a new 67 black cartridge.  Arrived, I istalled and it printed.  SO  MY CONCLUSION IS THAT A DRIED UP 67 CARTRIDGE WAS SEALED AND SHIPPED WITH THE MACHINE.  I HAD MADE A COMMENT BACK TO AMAZON ON THE NOTICE OF ITEM HAVING BEEN DELIVERED AND WAS IT OKAY? .  BUT NEVER HEARD ANYTHING BACK.  I DO NOT FEEL I SHOULD HAVE HAD TO ORDER OR PAY FOR A "NEW 67 BLACK CARTRIDGE"  TO REPLACE WHAT WAS SHIPPED

reviewTitle: Works fine when it decides to work at all, but double-sided copies are problematic
reviewDescription: Overall it does what I want, but in the first day of use I discovered two issues.  The first one really ticked me off.  That is that the printer cartridges supplied with the printer straight out of the box only contain a bare minimal amount of ink and half way through a printing job the black cartridge ran out of ink.  I did about 30 pages and then a page or two of low ink print quality and then nothing.  The second issue that I did not realize while reading the product description is that if you have a double-sided page, it is cumbersome to print both sides as a double-sided copy.  You have to print one side first, then take that copy and reverse it properly in the paper feeded and then reverse the original in the copy feeder tray and then print it and hope that you get it all correct.  That takes awhile to figure out how to line every thing up properly.  Haven't used the fax, scan, wi-fi or blue tooth features yet.  I returned it.  The second one doesn't work any better.  I think that it is just not very compatable with a computer that still uses Windows 7.  I also don't like using smart phones

9 months later I'm ready to use this thing as a boat anchor. Sometimes it does or doesn't use the document feeder to scan. Sometimes it does or doesn't put lines in my printed document. I use this for my home office and didn't get it to do too much heavy lifting, but it's still been disappointing. I guess for the price point this would be fine for your family's purposes (using the scanner glass for a page or two) or maybe printing concert ticket vouchers or something. It's been a nightmare to try to use consistently for work. And it constantly gives me "ink low" warnings even right after I change out the ink. I'll probably give it away to a college student or something.

Aunque cumple con su función, a veces se complica imprimir  lo deseado y comienza a imprimir  lo mismo una y otra vezQuizas sea pir mala operacion por que no soy muy diestro coneste tema. cometí un error al momento  de comprar, escoji la impresora equivocada, quería una que se pueda recargar la tinta.

I got this for my wife who is a teacher, here she is to tell you how she feels about this product: This printer is infuriating! I work hard and have only the evenings and early mornings to get papers ready for classes. I spend weekends fighting with this printer trying to print out copy sheets to then take to school to copy on their large printer. I will print out about 20-50 sheets of items that will need to be made into multiple copies for my classes. With no planning period, I have no time to waste. With this printer I have been wasting hours….not minutes, HOURS! I do not have time for a printer that will not wake up from its coma to print a single sheet of paper at 5:30 in the morning! Take this sucker back! I hate it. When it DOES print (few and far between moments) it is wonderful! But it will take us 1o-2 hours to get it to wake back up and work with our iPads! Maybe it is a PC only or Cell phone only printer. If so I missed that! I do not like buying electronics from the internet and this just helps to prove me right. 3 stars because when it does print, it does it well. I do not recommend to anyone who needs something done now.

reviewTitle: READ IF YOU NEED HELP WITH SET UP
reviewDescription: I was in a pickle and needed a printer FAST. During COVID, all of the printers have been limited supply so I felt I would take a chance on this one. First thing I noticed about this printer when I received it was there were NO instructions. You are instructed to download an app (HP Smart) and configure it all from there, however when I tried, the app wouldn't find any WiFi networks (when I knew there were plenty in my apartment building). THIS IS WHAT YOU NEED TO DO IF YOU HAVE ISSUES SETTING UP:1. Plug in the printer2. Place ink inside and paper in the feeder3. It will print a page (that I have attached in photos just in case) to help you set up4. Hold down the WiFi button AND the cancel button for 3 seconds until the power button flashes5. Move onto the app to continue configuring - it will "find" the printer and then allow you to connect to WiFiThey made this printer unnecessarily complicated to set up but once it is up, it works like a charm and you are even able to change the printer's email address. I tried to set this bad boy up on 4 different attempts and had to walk away 3x because it wouldn't connect to WiFi and I got frustrated. Happy with my purchase now, but I was about to throw it out the window for a second there... Anyways, overall, if you are tech-savvy, I would recommend this printer! I just suggest to the manufacturer that it COMES WITH the instruction sheet rather than making you print it prior to setting it up... that was odd.

reviewTitle: It prints, but lots of issues with it constantly.
reviewDescription: It does what its supposed to do - but every time I need to actually print something.  I end up having to re-pair and re-add the device many times before it finally works.  Its a hassle.  But its also an incredibly inexpensive so you get what you pay for.  Ive probably spent a good 5 hours troubleshooting this thing through the 10 times i've used it to print something.
It was very difficult to set up!  No instruction book accompanied the printer.

It seems like a reasonable good printer but my issue is that is goes offline quite frequently, like if I haven't used it in a day or so I have to go through the settings to get it working again which frankly speaking is quite annoying.

Had a little difficulty getting it connected wirelessly.  Once I got past that hurdle I learned several things.  It uses toner fast.  And I mean fast.  Had to replace both color and black within 1st week.  I bought it refurbished so maybe that was why because I'm still on the replacement cartridges after 2 and a half weeks. Some of my dislikes:  1) Does not print double sided.  2)  Cannot preview photos prior to printing so they're always off center, and there is always a white border of varying degrees even when selecting fill page.  Using my Samsung phone to print, perhaps that is the reason. 3)  Photo quality is very disappointing.  Select best quality and they don't come close to comparing to photos from CVS.  Maybe I chose poor quality photo paper, I'll purchase some more expensive paper and see if the quality improves.  On the bright side the fax and copy features were a breeze to set up and use. Also, I have not a single problem with a paper jam or any other mechanical issue.  For what I paid, $60,  I'm  satisfied and would buy it again.  It does what I need it to, but it sure would be nice if it printed good pictures as well as it performs other functions.

reviewTitle: Get ready to spend money on ink.
reviewDescription: This is an HP+ printer which means it will only accept hp ink cartridges.  Any others will be rejected, even if they are remanufactered hp cartridges.  It may seem like it accepts them and then you'll be in the middle of a print job and it will error telling you that one or both of your cartridges are bad. As far as print quality goes, and the ability to print directly from phone or tablet or computer without wires, its great, but that's where it ends. One ink cartridge with a high yield is 30.00, that is ridiculous.

reviewTitle: I remember when HP was the gold standard for printers... Don't buy HP!
reviewDescription: I work in IT and once lead a project to select a printer/copier/fax all in one vendor for a 3 billion dollar company. I have a lot of experience with printers and HP used to be the gold standard for commercial and consumer printing. I would NOT recommend them for consumer printing anymore!The printer itself is mostly ok. Like others I've had frustrating issues with connectivity. When it works it works fairly well. When it doesn't (usually when you are in a hurry and just need to print) it is a fun procedure of powering off and back on and or resetting things.My BIGGEST issue is with HPs attempts to FORCE you to use their online services, ink subscriptions, and paper subscriptions for a device that you purchased.They also do their best to prevent you from using third party print cartridges with a thinly veild excuse about better security. Thers are no known attacks in the wild of third party print cartridges being used to exploit a printer, only theoretical research funded by.... You guessed it... HP! A better approach to securing their printers (vs preventing third part ink cartridges) would be better security in their software and firmware.Stay far far away from consumer grade HP printers or you WILL regret it!
I had to buy new cartridges to get it to work. So money I saved was spent.

So the instructions left out the most important part of setting this printer up. I'm gonna say in all caps for the people in the back, after you power on the printer PRESS AND HOLD THE X BUTTON AND THE WIFI BUTTON TOGETHER FOR 10 SECONDS. It took probably 5 man hours before I called HP and had the tech walk me through the setup and I found out that was the step I was missing.On another note that pissed me off is that the NEW printer is out of warranty because its a year old so I'm not able to get tech support from HP or the free ink for 6 months.Also, this printer comes with color/black ink cartridge's that literally have only enough ink to print out a couple test pages and then you need to get new ink. In fact the black cartridge has nothing in it. It's basically a placebo. Absolutely horrible what HP has become. This printer is going directly back without passing go!
The printer used to much ink, I would not recommend this printer to anyone.

reviewTitle: Connectivity errors via iPhone and HP Chromebook.
reviewDescription: I connected using my iPhone 11 Pro Max. When I leave the house the printer obviously disconnects from my phone. But when I return I have to switch to the HP Printer through my WiFi settings. Kinda lame to have to manually switch any time I need to use the printer. Not a problem except nowhere on HP’s website is that factoid made accessible to the user...so had to find help in user subs. I tried to print some coloring pages for my child today. I used the browser files and downloaded to my photo library. Tried printing and failed. Downloaded to my docs/files instead. Then tried printing from that destination, unfortunately it failed. Tried using the coloring pages that are available through the HP Smart App…still failed. It presumed the size I wanted printed for the document to be 4x6 in size, but refused to print on 8.5 x 11 paper. The printer would not print unless I had the correct size of paper. I tried to find the setting options within the app and on the printer itself so I could change the printer paper size that it would be printing on. I unfortunately could not find that anywhere. I searched forums and HP Help and Support, but nothing. I guess I am too old school because I remember printers not giving a damn and just printing on paper that was in the printer. But unfortunately this printer is particular and temperamental. Your loss HP. I read the reviews and though the connection issues were fluke occurrences. But this particular printer does not like Apple products or Chrome books.
Never had a problem with my old printer but HAD to forcefully get a new one,  since I've had this one nothing but problems, it's never worked, so frustrating.

reviewTitle: HP does not support nor provide warranty! Nightmare installation
reviewDescription: Upon opening box I found printed page saying, "This item is not warranted by HP." Printer will not print, although it copies a page fine. Should printer ever decide to print, it appears every page needs to be converted to PDF form. Printer initially (must be within about 6 feet from my laptop) recognized my Wi-fi router and next day couldn't find printer.  Used HP troubleshooter that repeatedly couldn't find printer--but finally did and claimed printer was turned off!Wrong!  This printer makes non-stop noise when on! Received useless instructions to turn off router, then printer, but no change.  Virtual technical support repeatedly sent suggestions until I insisted I needed to talk by phone with support.  HP refused and advised, "printer sold with no warranty", thus will not help me. The only positive thing I can say is the return to Amazon looks easy as I can bring to Kohl's without worries about box--or label that I cannot print since I have no working printer!I lost 2 days time unable to print urgent documents.  The stress triggered a migraine headache that may take unknown quantity of days to resolve.

The printer comes only with two "setup cartridges", which got me most of the way through the internet-based software install (note: I had to go to support.hp.com to get software that worked).  However, those "setup cartridges" did not support printing a test page, so the install hung.  FORTUNATELY, I had Prime'd a pair of 67-series cartridges, was able to swap them in, was able to delete the first software install, and then re-load the software -- that completed the install.I sucessfully printed from my computer.  BUT, to scan a document to file the software demands that you use an online HP account !!!  You can't scan at all offline (except as a copier).  At that point I put the printer away for the night.

reviewTitle: Don't be afraid to buy "renewed" products!
reviewDescription: I had to replace my old printer, and I wanted functions (print, scan. etc.), but I didn't want to spend an arm and a leg because I don't use it that much.  I bought this HP 4152 All-in-one "renewed" because of the great value.  Renewed products don't come with user guides or manuals, so I went online and found a manual that I studied and studied so I would be completely familiar with the printer and all it's parts..  I also downloaded the HP Smart app (this is absolutely necessary!!) to my desktop computer to enable the set up.  Be sure to find the password of your wifi source...you will need to enter it.  The printer arrived and looked brand new......no dings, dents, no scrapes or chipped paint.  Using the HP Smart app from getting it out of the box to up and running probably took about  25 minutes.  Gone are the days of "plug and play" but  I thought it went very smooth (the only small bump was how to put the ink cartridges in their places).  I am NOT a 20 something tech savvy person.  I am an older woman, so if I did it so can you, it's all about preparation.  Am loving my new (to me) printer that is a wonderful value for the price!!!

I contacted and was told since the warranty is not through HP they cannot help get the printer setup. Quite frustrated because this is the third printer I’ll have to wait on a refund for. And I’m tech savvy…so I promise it’s not that I didn’t do my own trouble shooting.

It came with no information except a sheet showing it is an "Amazon refurbished" unit.  When you try to install it, it takes you to a driver site where they want you to sign to a $9.95 a month subscription. Try going through HP & you get a "This unit is out of warranty" flag.

After just a few short uses (maybe 3 or 4 pages), the PRINTER STOPPED WORKING COMPLETELY -WITH ALL NEW INK INSIDE! Never have I ever spent so much time trying to fix such a useless printer that doesn't work. How SHAMEFUL! DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!

This printer doesnt work at all. It printed once and since then all it does it tell me it doesnt have paper or just prints out blank paper. Troubleshooting doesnt help, restarting doesnt help, amazon doesnt help. Dont buy. Huge waste of money.

When I just looked at one part of the order, it specifically says "refurbished" but in another part it says "new."  Moral of the story, open the box even if you're not going to be able to install it right away, otherwise you might end up with something you definitely do not want.

reviewTitle: This is the last HP Printer I will buy; "InstantInk" is a nightmare figuring out how to turn it OFF
reviewDescription: HPs "Instant Ink" is an idiotic program that tries to force you into estimating how many pages you will print per month and then selling you a contract based on that with a monthly fee so they can "help you" and send ink before you run out.  No manual and no printer driver either, both required to be online to try and find.Worse, the "Instant Ink capable" cartridges that come with it were both 2/3 full after I took them new out of the sealed package AND there was NO red in the color cartridge.  I started the process of returning it based on the 1/3empty "NEW" cartridges but the 3rd party additional cartridges I had already both worked absolutely fine, included the color red and were full.  Printer is fine. HP sux arse.

reviewTitle: This was "out of warranty" according to HP
reviewDescription: When I tried to register the product, HP stated this printer was out of warranty - over a year and a half ago! I told them I JUST got it. They didn't know what to say. The colored ink wouldn't work properly. It wouldn't print red, so I bought a new cartridge. It worked, until about the 7th page and it started getting lines through the blue and fading. SCANNER DID NOT WORK. It was also flimsy, overall.  I purchased a different one, that would use the same ink, on sale from Staples. Hopefully this one will work.

I spent two hours on the phone with a tech person who could not help me despite her very diligent efforts. Perhaps this would work with a computer or an iPhone, but it was a total bust with my android. I will stay away from HP in the future.

I’d give 0 stars if I could, it will NOT stay connected to wireless network to print….and if you print an info sheet to see what the problem is, it says ‘connected to network’ in one spot and ‘not connected to internet’ in another spot….makes no sense….oh and HP support is an absolute joke, it was NO HELP at all….this is my 2nd HP printer to fail like this, I’ll never go with HP again

I then had to hold the Cancel and Wifi buttons for a few seconds until the power light flashed, and it finally showed up in the list of printers to set up for wifi. I am happy to have found the HP 4140 and an excellent value at $65 with a 90-day warranty.

Such a pain.Also, I do not like the paper feed that sticks up at the back; with my home office set up, I have to tug the printer forward about a foot every time I need to replenish the paper.
After 5 hours I think I finally got everything to work. They seem to make it harder or I can’t figure stuff out as easily now.

reviewTitle: I Don't Recommend Purchasing Returned Printers
reviewDescription: I purchase this printer be cared I trust Amazon.  I've bought refurbished/ returned terms from Amazon before with no issues.  This time was not the case.  When I took the printer out of the box I noticed there was no USB cord but I though I'd just use the old one.  I opened the scanner and found someone's school document with personal information.  I immediately suspected the printer had not been checked to see if it worked before sending it to me.  It was low on ink and the printing quality was terrible, and it was very slow to print.  After printing the second page, the printer disconnected from wi-fi and I could not get it to connect via wi-fi or USB.  I needed a printer so I went to a local retailer.  I found a newer version of this same printer for half the price, brand new.  I do appreciate how easy it is to return items to Amazon.

reviewTitle: How I got my printer to connect to wifi.
reviewDescription: I had purchase this printer a few weeks back just unbox it. I am not a tech person. This took me almost an hour to get it to work but thanks you tube. Firstly the printer comes with no USB cable or instructions. I have the exact printer different model number. Deskjet 4100 is what I have. Connecting this with your windows 10. Press the wifi button on the printer and Press the Wps on your router. Also download the Hp smart app from the app store. Open that app and press add printer it will search for the printer. Once connected to the internet. Add the printer continue to follow the steps. Hopefully it works.

The output of prints, scans and copies is excellent, though it seems to be quite ink-hungry (I burned through 2 black cartridges in 3 weeks, and I didn't print but 100 pages.) What genuinely sucks is the HP "Smart" (here a euphemism for "Stupid") setup software. I couldn't get it to work over Wi-Fi, and every time I deleted the printer and reinstalled, it did something different. I couldn't even get it to work using a USB cable. I backed up and installed HP's previous setup software, HP Printer Assistant and finally got it to work using a USB cable, but why buy a Wi_Fi capable printer in the first place if it needs a cable to work? You can't even set it up with either app without a USB cable. Both apps make you use a cable because the printer does not have a touch screen, and it says nothing about this on the outside of the sealed box, so I had to make a second trip to buy a cable. Since HP knows darn well that it requires a cable to set it up, they should include one with the printer or at least warn you that you need one. Bottom line: great printer if you don't need to run it over Wi-Fi, but seriously FAIL setup software.
